meanings.definition: To move or slide quickly or hastily in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The cat was scootching across the floor to catch the toy.
meanings.sent2: I saw the kids scootching down the slide at the playground.
meanings.sent3: The penguin was scootching around on the ice, trying to keep its balance.
meanings.sent4: Time was scootching along, and soon it was time to go home.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel was scootching up the tree trunk with lightning speed.

meanings.definition: The act of moving or sliding quickly or hastily in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The scootching of the chair across the room startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent2: I heard the scootching of the skateboard as it rolled down the street.
meanings.sent3: The sound of scootching echoed through the hallway, making everyone curious.
meanings.sent4: The scootching of the train on the tracks was a rhythmic lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The scootching of the mop on the floor was music to the cleaner's ears.
